content:
VisualStyleElement+Spin+UpHorizontal Class

In this Article

Provides VisualStyleElement objects for each state of the right-pointing arrow for a spin button control (also known as an up-down control). This class cannot be inherited.

Syntax

Declaration

public static class VisualStyleElement.Spin.UpHorizontal

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • VisualStyleElement+Spin+UpHorizontal

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

Each property of the VisualStyleElement.Spin.UpHorizontal class gets a VisualStyleElement for a different state of the right-pointing arrow for a spin button.

Properties summary

Disabled

Gets a visual style element that represents a right-pointing spin button arrow in the disabled state.
Hot

Gets a visual style element that represents a right-pointing spin button arrow in the hot state.
Normal

Gets a visual style element that represents a right-pointing spin button arrow in the normal state.
Pressed

Gets a visual style element that represents a right-pointing spin button arrow in the pressed state.

Properties

  • Disabled

    Gets a visual style element that represents a right-pointing spin button arrow in the disabled state.

    public static System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement Disabled { get; }

    Property Value

    • VisualStyleElement

      A VisualStyleElement that represents a right-pointing spin button arrow in the disabled state.

    Remarks

    You can use the VisualStyleElement returned by the Disabled property to create a VisualStyleRenderer.

    Example

    The following code example demonstrates how to create a VisualStyleRenderer with the VisualStyleElement returned by the Disabled property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the formâ€™s Paint event and call the DrawVisualStyleElement_Button_PushButton4 method from the Paint event-handling method, passing e as PaintEventArgs. 

        public void DrawVisualStyleElement_Spin_UpHorizontal4(PaintEventArgs e)
    {
        if (VisualStyleRenderer.IsElementDefined(
            VisualStyleElement.Spin.UpHorizontal.Disabled))
        {
            VisualStyleRenderer renderer =
                 new VisualStyleRenderer(VisualStyleElement.Spin.UpHorizontal.Disabled);
            Rectangle rectangle1 = new Rectangle(10, 50, 50, 50);
            renderer.DrawBackground(e.Graphics, rectangle1);
            e.Graphics.DrawString("VisualStyleElement.Spin.UpHorizontal.Disabled",
                 this.Font, Brushes.Black, new Point(10, 10));
        }
        else
            e.Graphics.DrawString("This element is not defined in the current visual style.",
                 this.Font, Brushes.Black, new Point(10, 10));
    }

        Public Sub DrawVisualStyleElement_Spin_UpHorizontal4(ByVal e As PaintEventArgs)
        If (VisualStyleRenderer.IsElementDefined( _
         VisualStyleElement.Spin.UpHorizontal.Disabled)) Then
            Dim renderer As New VisualStyleRenderer _
              (VisualStyleElement.Spin.UpHorizontal.Disabled)
            Dim rectangle1 As New Rectangle(10, 50, 50, 50)
            renderer.DrawBackground(e.Graphics, rectangle1)
            e.Graphics.DrawString("VisualStyleElement.Spin.UpHorizontal.Disabled", _
              Me.Font, Brushes.Black, New Point(10, 10))
        Else
            e.Graphics.DrawString("This element is not defined in the current visual style.", _
              Me.Font, Brushes.Black, New Point(10, 10))
        End If
    End Sub

Handle the formâ€™s Paint event and call the DrawVisualStyleElement_Spin_UpHorizontal1 method from the Paint event-handling method, passing e as PaintEventArgs.
